name: CompoundObserver
comment:
polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver is a polymer/polymer-polymer_element.Bindable object which knows how to listen to multiple values (registered via polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.addPath or polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.addObserver) and invoke a callback when one or more of the values have changed.

var obj = new ObservableMap.from({'a': 1, 'b': 2}); var otherObj = new ObservableMap.from({'c': 3});

var observer = new CompoundObserver()

 ..addPath(obj, 'a');
 ..addObserver(new PathObserver(obj, 'b'));
 ..addPath(otherObj, 'c');
 ..open((values) {
   for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++) {
     print('The value at index $i is now ${values[i]}');
   }
 });

obj'a' = 10; // print will be triggered async

addPath.name: addPath
addPath.comment: Adds a dependency on the property polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.addPath.path accessed from polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.addPath.object. polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.addPath.path can be a polymer/polymer-polymer_element.PropertyPath or a dart-core.String. If it is omitted an empty path will be used.

open.name: open
open.comment:
Initiates observation and returns the initial value. The callback will be passed the updated polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.value, and may optionally be declared to take a second argument, which will contain the previous value.

Implementation note: a third argument can also be declared, which will receive a list of objects and paths, such that list[2 * i] will access the object and list[2 * i + 1] will access the path, where i is the order of the polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.addPath call. This parameter is only used by package:polymer as a performance optimization, and should not be relied on in new code.

value=.name: value=
value=.comment: This can be implemented for two-way bindings. By default does nothing. Note: setting the value of a polymer/polymer-polymer_element.Bindable must not call the callback with the new value. Any pending change notifications must be discarded.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

value.name: value
value.comment: Gets the current value of the bindings.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

close.name: close
close.comment: Stops future notifications and frees the reference to the callback passed to polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.open, so its memory can be collected even if this Bindable is alive.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

open.name: open
open.comment:
Initiates observation and returns the initial value. The callback will be called with the updated polymer/polymer-polymer_element.CompoundObserver.value.

Some subtypes may chose to provide additional arguments, such as polymer/polymer-polymer_element.PathObserver providing the old value as the second argument. However, they must support callbacks with as few as 0 or 1 argument. This can be implemented by performing an "is" type test on the callback.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
